Guardian Life Insurance Guardian Policy Admin Center


Project: Guardian Life Insurance Guardian Policy Admin Center
Designation at Virtusa: QA Manager
Role in the project: QA Manager
Duration – Aug 2014 to Apr 2015
Team Size – 48
Business Problem:Under Virtusa QA Managed Services, GPAC is one of the Guardian’s (Individual Life) critical applications for Policy Administration, which interfaces with other streams of applications. GPAC has regular quarterly and sub-releases for enhancements/production defects. Guardian to adapt Business Capability Modeling for its underwriting projects, define business capabilities, with Level 1 and Level 2 capabilities based on the strategic attributes like Business Benefits, Segments, Cost and also based on the attributes like applications, roles etc. The Business Capability Model to be implemented in HP Application Life Management tool (HP-ALM) with the customization of Requirement Module and End to End SDLC process, at Enterprise level Projects. Business Analysis and Quality Assurance skills are needed.
Environment: Java, O3, DB2, ClearQuest, SharePoint, Office 365 and HP Unified Functional Testing, HP ALM 11.0, Virtusa Business Capability Modelling
Project Role:
  • Gather, analyze and review the high level requirements
  • Participate and contribute in Business Requirement Engineering, through Business Capability Modeling workshop, where the Business Capability Models with Level 1- Primary and Level 2 -Sub Capabilities are defined, reviewed and accepted
  • ALM 11.0 Requirement Module was customized with Virtusa Business Modelling
  • Functional requirements, Business Requirements, Business Rules were analyzed, uploaded and reviewed in ALM for developing the test cases and execution and then the ALM Defect Module
  • Review and validate Requirement Traceability Matrix for test coverage developed through ALM
  • Develop Project Preliminary Plan, Project Plan, Business Capability Modeling Key Success Factors, Knowledge Transfer Plan, Implementation Plan, Execution and Tracking Plan
  • Reviewed the testability of the requirements and identified critical functional areas to be tested as new test scenarios and the regression test scenarios for each release
  • Schedule and conducted test scenarios walkthrough to stake holders (Business, Development and UAT) after internal reviews/feedbacks incorporated
  • SIT scope management for each release, requirement walkthrough meeting and responsible for SIT Release Planning, Estimation and Test Execution planning
  • Prepare Program Quality Plan and review with the stakeholders and publish in HP Application Life Cycle Management and Chrous (Project Management Tool)
  • Estimate, set targets and milestones and prepare Project Score Card through HP ALM.
  • Action items arising from expectations and timelines for deliverable is tracked and maintained through HP ALM
  • Scope Changes restricted by pro-active planning and schedules
  • Responsible for designing QA Test Strategies and QA Test Plans for each release
  • Conduct walkthrough of the Test Plan and getting the sign off from client after requirement walkthrough
  • Responsible for scheduling calls with Development/Prod support team at onsite, for required support in loading and refreshing test data in SIT Environments and test execution, generating GPAC batch transactions
  • Conduct daily scrum calls with offshore QA team, client QA Analyst & stakeholders
  • Clarifications requests received from the offshore team is getting clarified by next day, by interacting with the stakeholders
  • Conducting Defect Triage meetings with stake holders on weekly basis
  • Coordinated daily meeting with the Development Manager at Guardian, so the defects are fixed and tested to closure. Reused 35% of test scripts
  • Coordinated with other app stream Leads at onsite, QA Manager & Leads at offshore
  • Responsible for project monitoring and tracking, execution of manual and test automation for each release, identifying dependencies, risks and mitigation plans and smooth completion of release as per the plan
  • Responsible for daily status reports, weekly status reports and participate in Weekly Management Meetings with Guardian Management for GPAC related project status
  • Automation Estimation, Planning, Execution/ Tracking using UFT through offshore automation resources
  • Introduced an excel-based Dashboard for CQ tracking/reporting tool that interacts with Clear Quest to generate the report-handy tool for instant project status
  • Built the Functional Dependency Matrix for GPAC application for identifying regression areas quickly and implementing the regression test suite
  • Introduced documented QA process for policy loading/ILDRS loading to SIT
  • Developed GPAC Policy Identification Matrix as an innovation, which helped to reduce the time required for loading the policies from production to SIT Region
  • Test Scenario Matrix for E-Juvenile Enhancement Functionality was prepared by me for walkthrough with stakeholders
  • Trained, guided and motivated the offshore team for performance excellence-best results
  • Developed QA Program Management Framework for Guardian, analyzing the issues and proposing solutions, which serves as a Best Practices Document
  • Earned the confidence of the Guardian Senior QA Manager/ Development Manager/Business Analyst Managers and onsite teams by building a very good business and professional relationship
  • Gained considerable functional knowledge on GPAC within a short time and this was stated by the client as a special mention in the Client Score Card
  • Successfully completed the R3, R4 -2014,R0.5 GPAC release on time and with good quality and earned client appreciations with Client Delight Index of 8/10
  • Meetings with Virtusa Program Management Director, Account Management and ISQ Director, got their guidance for successful execution of the project releases
  • Served as a very critical resource for success of the GPAC release testing, for completion of GPAC releases on time with good quality and working with the teams of other application streams collaboratively for the successful completion of releases and the success of the Virtusa Guardian QA Managed Services
  • Responsible for Root Cause Analysis for UAT/Production defects and meeting the SLA requirements and met the target of less than 1% Defect Leakage to UAT
  • Consistently enabled every release to go production without any production defects on time meeting all SLAs and achieved Delivery Maturity Index of 5 and Client Delight Index of 9.25 and Net Promotor Score of 9.
